   +----zeta.form.Form
The pure class interface. 
public abstract class Form
The class of interaction forms.

Interaction forms represent an abstract way for tools to specify communication with users. Sessions managers may interpret forms in a shell style or by graphical user interfaces.

Author:
Wolfgang Grieskamp (wg@cs.tu-berlin.de)
Version: $Id: Form.pizza,v 1.7 2000/05/14 17:43:32 wg Exp $
See also:
LiteralForm, TextForm, FileForm, UnitForm, ContentTypeForm, OptionForm, ChoiceForm, SeqForm

Form
public Form();

style
public Style[] style;
A field holding an array of general style configure options telling how this form if displayed in a GUI. The options apply not to all form subclasses; if they don't apply, they are silentely ignored.

parse
public abstract int parse(Session session,
                          Locator locator,
                          String[] words,
                          int start)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.FormFailed;
Parse the given sequence of words starting at index. Return the index of the next word not consumed. Return -1 to indicate that parsing has failed for syntactical reasons. Throw a session failure if parsing runs in a non-recoverable error. It is expected that such errors are augmented with diagnostics by the individual parse functions using the sessions message system. The parsing result is entered into the forms internal state. The session under which parsing happens is passed, also a locator to be used in diagnostics produced by parsing.

unparse

public abstract String[] unparse(Session session);
Unparse the internal state of the form converting it to a sequence of words. Parsing the returned sequence should reconstruct the forms internal state, if it succeeds. The session under which unparsing happens is passed.

getSyntax

public abstract String getSyntax();
Get a syntactic description of this form.

style

public Form style(Style style);
Add a style to this form. Return this form.

Note that this method returns an object of the general Form type, which wouldn't allow you to apply form specific style methods further on. When using a functional style for constructing forms, first attach specific, then general styles: 

   new TheForm(...).style(new TheForm.Style.Specific(...))
                   .style(new Form.Style.General1(...))
                   .style(new Form.Style.General2(...))
                   . ...

style

public Form style(Style[] styles);
Add an array of styles to this form. Return this form.

describe

public Form describe(String label);
A shortcut for adding a label style.

describe

public Form describe(String label,
                     String tip);
A shortcut for adding a label and tool-tip style.

textSize

public Form textSize(int columns,
                     int rows);
A shortcut for setting the preferred size in text units and fixing it.

size

public Form size(int width,
                 int height);
A shortcut for setting the preferred size in pixels and fixing it.

public static class Style
public static class Style
The class of general form styles. Not all of them apply to all variants of forms; if a style doesn't applies, it is ignored. Note that individual forms may provide further styles.
